content: with mc chain 15 making sure 1st 3 chs are fairly loose round 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and next 8 chs 3 single_crochet in each of next 5 chain 24 single_crochet turn round 2 skip 1st single_crochet slip_stitch in each of next 23 single_crochet leave 12 tail to sew tail to body fasten_off © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 3 - poncho the monkey finishing 1 stuff body do not sew shut you may wish to put some plastic pellets in the bottom of the body before stuffing to add some weight and stability if you do i recommend placing the pellets inside a small fabric pouch before putting them in the body otherwise they are likely to eventually fall out between the spaces of the single crochets this is not only messy but also a potential choking hazard for small children i cut two circles approx 3 in diameter from scrap fabric sew them together leaving a 1 opening fill the pouch with a scant ¼ cup of pellets and then stitch the opening shut 2 sew head to body using inside loops only of last round of body 3 stuff arms lightly and sew to body 4 sew tail to body 5 weave ends in ears and then sew ears to head i usually sew them between round 8 & 9 6 stuff muzzle lightly and sew to face using inside loops only of last round of muzzle 7 sew felt eyes to face alternatively embroider eyes to face 8 embroider eyebrows and mouth fig 3 © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 4 - poncho the monkey fig 1 fig 2 fig 3 showing blue loop start of slip_stitch in last cc double_crochet of last cc double_crochet © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved - 5 -
